contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox album | <!-- See Wikipedia:WikiProject_Albums --> | Name = Viva Last Blues | Type = [[Album]] | Artist = [[Will Oldham|Palace Music]] | Cover = Vivalastblues albumcover.gif | Released = August 21, 1995 | Recorded = [[Alabama]], [[United States]] | Genre = Singer/Songwriter | Length = 31:27 | Label = [[Drag City (record label)|Drag City]]<br /><small>DC65 ([[United States|US]], LP, CS, CD)</small><br />[[Palace Records]]<br /><small>PR4 ([[United States|US]], LP, CS, CD)</small><br /> [[Domino Records|Domino]]<br /><small>WIG21 ([[United Kingdom|UK]], LP, CS, CD) | Producer = [[Steve Albini]] | Last album = ''[[Days in the Wake]]''<br />(1994) | This album = '''''Viva Last Blues'''''<br />(1995) | Next album = ''[[Arise Therefore]]''<br />(1996) }} {{Album ratings | rev1 = [[About.com]] | rev1Score = {{Rating|5|5}} <ref>[http://altmusic.about.com/od/1990s/fr/palacemusic.htm About Review]</ref> | rev2 = [[Allmusic]] | rev2Score = {{Rating|4.5|5}} <ref>{{Allmusic|class=album|id=r218529}}</ref> }} '''''Viva Last Blues''''' is an album by [[Will Oldham|Palace Music]], featuring Will Oldham on vocals and guitar. The album was recorded by [[Steve Albini]] and was released in 1995 on [[Drag City (record label)|Drag City]]. The artwork is by [[Dianne Bellino]] (cover drawing) and [[Cynthia Kirkwood]] (painting). The album was listed as #60 on [[Pitchfork Media]]'s [http://www.pitchforkmedia.com/article/feature/36737/Staff_List_Top_100_Albums_of_the_1990s/page_5 "Top 100 Albums of the 1990s"]. ==Track listing== # "More Brother Rides" – 3:18 # "Viva Ultra" – 3:18 # "The Brute Choir" – 2:43 # "The Mountain Low" – 2:44 # "Tonight's Decision (And Hereafter)" – 4:10 # "Work Hard/Play Hard" – 2:50 # "New Partner" – 3:54 # "Cat's Blues" – 3:18 # "We All, Us Three, Will Ride" – 2:56 # "Old Jerusalem" – 2:16 ==UK limited edition bonus 7"== # "Black/Rich Tune" – 3:19 # "You Have Cum..." (alt. version) – 2:51 ==Personnel== * [[Liam Hayes]] – piano and organ * [[Jason Loewenstein]] – drums and additional singing * [[Ned Oldham]] – bass, slide guitar, and additional singing * [[Will Oldham]] - singing and guitar * [[Bryan Rich]] – lead guitar == References == {{Reflist}} {{Will Oldham}} [[Category:1995 albums]] [[Category:Domino Recording Company albums]] [[Category:Drag City albums]] [[Category:Will Oldham albums]] [[Category:Albums produced by Steve Albini]]
